trans-unit.source: Represents a 4 x 4 matrix used for transformations in 3-D space.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D> has the following row-vector syntax:
Note that because the fourth column is also accessible, the matrix allows developers to represent affine as well as non-affine transforms.
Matrices can be appended or prepended to other matrices.
Appending matrix A to matrix B denotes a transformation by B and then by A:
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
The value in the first row and first column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M11%2A> property.
The value in the first row and second column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M12%2A> property.
The value in the first row and third column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M13%2A> property.
The value in the first row and fourth column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M14%2A> property.
The value in the second row and first column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M21%2A> property.
The value in the second row and second column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M22%2A> property.
The value in the second row and third column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M23%2A> property.
The value in the second row and fourth column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M24%2A> property.
The value in the third row and first column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M31%2A> property.
The value in the third row and second column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M32%2A> property.
The value in the third row and third column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M34%2A> property.
The value in the third row and fourth column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M33%2A> property.
The value in the fourth row and fourth column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.M44%2A> property.
*offsetX*
The value in the fourth row and first column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.OffsetX%2A> property.
*offsetY*
The value in the fourth row and second column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.OffsetY%2A> property.
*offsetZ*
The value in the fourth row and third column of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.OffsetZ%2A> property.
Constructor that sets matrix's initial values.
Value of the (1,1) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (1,2) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (1,3) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (1,4) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (2,1) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (2,2) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (2,3) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (2,4) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (3,1) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (3,2) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (3,3) field of the new matrix.
Value of the (3,4) field of the new matrix.
Value of the X offset field of the new matrix.
Value of the Y offset field of the new matrix.
Value of the Z offset field of the new matrix.
Value of the (4,4) field of the new matrix.
Appends a specified matrix to the current matrix.
Matrices can be appended or prepended to other matrices.
Appending matrix A to matrix B denotes a transformation by B and then by A:
Prepending A to B denotes a transformation by A and then by B:
To transform point P by A and then by B, append B to A:
Matrix to append.
Retrieves the determinant of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The determinant of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Tests equality between two matrices.
Object to test for equality.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the matrices are equal.
Tests equality between two matrices.
The Matrix3D to which to compare.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the matrices are equal.
Tests equality between two matrices.
The first Matrix3D to compare.
The second Matrix3D to compare.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the matrices are equal.
Returns the hash code for this matrix
Integer that specifies the hash code for this matrix.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> is invertible.
`true` if the Matrix3D structure has an inverse; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Changes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure into an identity <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>.
In an identity matrix, all coefficients are 0 except the [1,1][2,2][3,3][4,4] coefficients, which are set to 1.
The identity matrix is special in that when it is applied to vertices, they are unchanged.
The identity matrix is used as the starting point for matrices that modify vertex values to create rotations, translations, and any other transformations that can be represented by a 4x4 matrix.
The identity Matrix3D.
Inverts this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
To determine whether a Matrix3D structure is invertible, read its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.HasInverse%2A> property.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the matrix is not invertible.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure is affine.
`true` if the Matrix3D structure is affine; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure is an identity Matrix3D.
In an identity matrix, all coefficients are 0 except the [1,1][2,2][3,3][4,4] coefficients, which are set to 1.
The identity matrix is special in that when it is applied to vertices, they are unchanged.
The identity matrix is used as the starting point for matrices that modify vertex values to create rotations, translations, and any other transformations that can be represented by a 4x4 matrix.
`true` if the Matrix3D structure is an identity Matrix3D; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets the value of the first row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The value of the first row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.

The value of the fourth row and fourth column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Multiplies the specified matrices.
Matrix to multiply.
Matrix by which the first matrix is multiplied.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> that is the result of multiplication.
Gets or sets the value of the fourth row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The value of the fourth row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the value of the fourth row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The value of the fourth row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the value of the fourth row and third column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The value of the fourth row and third column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> instances for exact equality.
Note that double values can acquire error when operated upon, so that an exact comparison between two values that are logically equal may fail.
Furthermore, using this equality operator, Double.NaN is not equal to itself.
The first matrix to compare.
The second matrix to compare.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the two matrix instances are equal.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> instances for exact inequality.
Note that double values can acquire error when operated upon, so that an exact comparison between two values that are logically inequal may fail.
Furthermore, using this equality operator, Double.NaN is not equal to itself.
The first matrix to compare.
The second matrix to compare.
<xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the two matrix instances are inequal.
Multiplies the specified matrices.
Matrix to multiply.
Matrix by which the first matrix is multiplied.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> that is the result of multiplication.
Converts a string representation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure into the equivalent Matrix3D structure.
String representation of the Matrix3D.
Matrix3D structure represented by the string.
Prepends a specified matrix to the current matrix.
Matrix to prepend.
Appends a rotation transform to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the rotation.
Rotates this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> about the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the rotation.
Center <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Prepends a rotation about a specified center <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the rotation.
Center <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> about which to rotate.
Prepends a rotation specified by a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Quaternion representing rotation.
Appends the specified scale <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Vector3D by which to scale this Matrix3D structure.

Scales this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> about the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref>.
Vector3D by which to scale this Matrix3D structure.
Point3D about which to scale.
Prepends the specified scale transformation about the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> by which to scale this Matrix3D structure.
Point3D about which to scale.
Prepends the specifed scale <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Vector3D by which to scale this Matrix3D structure.
Changes this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure into an identity matrix.
In an identity matrix, all coefficients are 0 except the [1,1][2,2][3,3][4,4] coefficients, which are set to 1.
The identity matrix is special in that when it is applied to vertices, they are unchanged.
The identity matrix is used as the starting point for matrices that modify vertex values to create rotations, translations, and any other transformations that can be represented by a 4x4 matrix.
Creates a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
String representation of this Matrix3D structure.
Creates a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Culture-specified formatting information.
String representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> and returns the result.
Point3D to transform.
The result of transforming point by this Matrix3D.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the transform is not affine.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> objects in the array by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>.
Point3D objects to transform.
The original points in the array are replaced by their transformed values.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the transform is not affine.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> and returns the result..
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> to transform.
The result of transforming point by this Matrix3D.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> objects in the array by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> and returns the result.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> objects to transform.
The original points in the array are replaced by their transformed values.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> to transform.
The result of transforming vector by this Matrix3D.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> objects in the array by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> objects to transform.
The original Vector3D objects in the array are replaced by their transformed values.
Appends a translation of the specified offset to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the offset for transformation.
Prepends a translation of the specified offset to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the offset for transformation.
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
The format to use.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The provider to use to format the value.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
